question: Which are the two signatories to the "Canas-Jerez Treaty of 1858"?
option2: United States of America and Mexico
explanation: Costa Rica and Nicaragua were the two nations signatories to the "Canas-Jerez Treaty of 1858". It was signed by Maximo Jerez of Nicaragua and Jose Maria Canas of Costa Rica. This treaty forms the basis for "San Juan River Border Dispute" and "Isla Calero Border Dispute of 2010" between Costa Rica and Nicaragua.
